intro: Clidemia capillaris, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a soft, hairy texture, and its flowers are small, pink or white, arranged in clusters. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Clidemia capillaris plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and birds.
